com.here.platform.location.tpeg2.olr

Class GridLocationReference

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.platform.location.tpeg2.olr.GridLocationReference
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractLocationReference, java.io.Serializable, scala.Equals, scala.Product

    public class GridLocationReference
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractLocationReference, scala.Product, scala.Serializable
    A GridLocationReference refers to a rectangular grid that is not tied to the road network.

    The grid is described based on a rectangle defining the southwesternmost cell which then gets extended to the north and east respectively. The grid coordinates can later be used to refer to the cells of the grid using their column and row numbers, e.g. for local weather reports.

    param: baseElement The southwesternmost (lower left) cell of the grid. param: nrColumns Number of columns (to the east), with nrColumns &gt; 1. param: nrRows Number of rows (to the north), with nrRows &gt; 1. param: isFuzzyArea The grid is to be interpreted as a rough enclosing rectangle rather than the exact location.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
